snippet: Maj. Gen. Harold J. Greene, a veteran acquisitions officer who had not seen combat before, was helping complete the transition to Afghan control.
abstract: Maj Gen Harold J Greene, who was killed in Afghanistan as he helped complete military transition, was unusual among the high command; an engineer by training, Greene was known as a 'gadget guru,' who worked for years to integrate cutting edge communication technology into an armed forces that often prizes hardware over software.

byline.original: By ALAN RAPPEPORT and HELENE COOPER

lead_paragraph: Maj. Gen. Harold J. Greene, a veteran acquisitions officer who had not seen combat before, was helping complete the transition to Afghan control.

headline.main: Slain General in Afghanistan Was Quietly Effective Leader, Known for Technical Skill
headline.print_headline: A Quietly Effective Leader Known for Technical Skill

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
